content.description: Starts in the center of the bowl and follows a slightly right-of-center line for the first few moves. Then moves left toward the center. Follow this straight up and then up the center "column".
content.protection: TR anchored with trees. Easy access to trees by going around to the right when looking at the cliff face.

content.description: Starts at the bottom of a very prominent crack on the left side of the bowl. Follow the crack up and traverse right at the ledge. Continue up the left side of the center "column" to finish.
content.protection: TR anchored with trees. Easy access to the trees around the right side when looking at the wall.

content.description: Starting in the center of the bowl there are a couple of obvious handholds just to the left. This route follows a course slightly to the left of center. After the ledge, go strait up the front of the center "column".
content.protection: TR anchored with trees. Easy access to trees by going around to the right of the cliff.

content.description: Follows a line of "steps" up the right side and then moves left to get to the ledge. Continues up the right side of the center "column".
content.protection: TR setup anchored to trees at the top of the cliff. Easy access to the trees by going around the right side of the cliff.

content.description:
Not world-class climbing, but close to State College and PSU. 

  Top Rope, Bouldering, Possible Trad. 

  Cliff runs parallel to Spring Creek on the opposite side from Rock Rd. There are multiple faces along the cliff. Around 50ft in most places. The rock in some areas is pretty crumbly and hard on the hands. Good trees for top-rope anchors at the top of the cliff with easy access from around the sides of the cliff. 

  At this point only the large bowl-like section of the wall on the far right (when facing the cliff) has been climbed. There are 4 established routes there. Still a lot of unexplored climbs at Little Scandinavia! 

  Will be putting up photos showing the 4 established routes soon.
